channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IL

item.title: Report X-2023070874
item.description:
Report X-2023070874

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-08T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-07
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE IS RIPPED TORN AND WET. AFTER INSPECTION WE FOUND THE GLASS BOTTLE BROKEN AND HAS LEAKED CONTENT CAUSING CARTON DAMAGE. PACKAGE DISCOVERED ON THE LOAD SIDE BEFORE DISPATCH. DescribePack: ONE OF THE GLASS BOTTLES WAS TOTALLY SHATTERED DurationRel: 25 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS TAKEN TO HAZMAT CAGE

item.title: Report X-2023070786
item.description:
Report X-2023070786

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-06
  • City: CHAMPAIGN
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered by a package handler, and brought over to QA in lined tote ASAP, where it was then placed in a lined haz-drum right away. Goggles, gloves, and apron were used in this process. DescribePack: Cap was slightly off. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was taken to QA immediately in a lined tote, and then put into a line haz-drum ASAP

item.title: Report X-2023070775
item.description:
Report X-2023070775

  • City: CHICAGO

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The previously processed steel drum was dented around the neck of the drum and slight movement of pail caused internal release or drip of the flammable product inside DescribePack: Dented on the top of the pail, not visible DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in black tote to catch any leaking product.

item.title: Report X-2023070740
item.description:
Report X-2023070740

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-04
  • City: CHAMPAIGN
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE FOUND WET. UPON INSPECTION, ONE BOTTLE HAD LEAKED FROM LOOSE CAP AND SOILED OTHERS. PACKAGE CONTAINED; SPILLAGE ABSORBED. DescribePack: ONE BOTTLE LEAKED FROM LOOSE CAP. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE CONTAINED; SPILLAGE ABSORBED.

item.title: Report X-2023070739
item.description:
Report X-2023070739

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-04
  • City: ROMEOVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet in load 2 after being dropped off by the tugger. Package had Corrosive HazMat labeling and was determined to be a HazMat. One of the packages corners was wet and leaking. Package was immediately taken out of the load areas and isolated from the rest of the staff. DescribePack: All 4 of the bottle's caps were taped down, in what seems to be an attempt to fix the leak. However, this did not work, and 2 of the 4 bottles began leaking out of their caps. The seals to each of the items were faulty and did not prevent any leakage. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was taken to the HazMat cage for isolation and processing.

item.title: Report X-2023070654
item.description:
Report X-2023070654

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-30
  • City: CAROL STREAM
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: One bottle had a loose cap and as a result leakage damage and soil stain damage occurred. Package was processed according to Damaged Hazmat procedures. Recommend better cap sealing methods. DescribePack: Soil stain damage to sides of box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Damaged item was placed inside a hazardous materials back with absorbent pads to contain any excess spillage.

item.title: Report E-2023070532
item.description:
Report E-2023070532

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-30
  • City: MELROSE PARK
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 30, 2023, one (1) 330-gallon tote's cap came loose and released five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted surface. The cap was resecured. HCE deployed absorbents to the released material and utilized hand tools to collect the impacted solids. All waste was contained in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The drum was labeled and staged onsite to be profiled and disposed of by R+L personnel.

item.description:
Report E-2023070349

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-08T00:23:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-24
  • City: MONEE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GROENDYKE TRANSPORT INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver stated customer loaded trailer and didn't get dome lid tight. Product leaked out of the dome lid. There is 1/2 gal of product on the ground. Driver has product contained. Third party cleanup crew found that 5 of the 6 hold-down bolts were loose causing the liquid to be released.
